name: AI Code Assistants
description: "Tools like GitHub Copilot
column6: Claude to assist with code generation and suggestions"

name: Apollo mcp
description: Apollo MCP Server provides a standard way for AI models to access and orchestrate your APIs running with Apollo.

name: Babel
description: A JavaScript compiler

name: Bug Bounty Program
description: For identifying and remediating security vulnerabilities with the help of external security researchers. Program overview at artsy.net/security.

name: Bun
description: runtime
column6: A JavaScript runtime designed as a drop-in replacement for Node.js. Aims to be fast by using the Zig programming language and integrating a bundler

name: CircleCI
description: For continuous integration over other services like Travis or Semaphore. Shared orbs and contexts help our projects apply best practices.

name: Claude Pro
description: "Anthropic's Claude Pro LLM service; provides higher usage limits and features compared to the free tier"

name: Codepush
description: Microsoft codepush allows delivering updates over the air to javascript based mobile apps

name: Elixir
description: A dynamic
column6: functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications.

name: Embeddings
description: Dense vector mathematical representation of content, suitable for semantic search

name: Expo Updates
description: Allows for delivering over-the-air updates to React Native apps.

name: External LLM chatbot
description: Risk of off-topic, unsafe, inaccurate responses (note: collector vs external)

name: Fast agent
description: lets you create and interact with sophisticated Agents and Workflows in minutes. It's multi-modal - supporting Images and PDFs in Prompts, Resources and MCP Tool Call results.

name: GitHub LLM tools
description: GitHub's suite of tools for AI-assisted development

name: GraphQL Stitching
description: We prefer to connect to upstream REST APIs instead of GraphQL APIs.

name: GraphQL
description: Appreciated for its flexibility and efficiency for clients.

name: HashiCorp Vault
description: Secrets management solution to securely store and access sensitive application information

name: Heroku
description: We prefer kubernetes where we have shared solutions for authorization, logging, monitoring, alerting, scaling, and routing.

name: Hypermedia
description: While discoverable and easy to consume, we've found hypermedia APIs inefficient to consume.

name: Internal Agentic AI
description: "Internal development of AI agents to perform specific tasks autonomously within our systems. Monorepo at github.com/artsy/artsy-agent"

name: JSON
description: We prefer JSON over most other data formats for its self-describing properties.

name: Kubernetes
description: We manage staging and production clusters, and have solutions for logging, monitoring, alerting, scaling, and routing. See Hokusai and Substance repos.

name: LabFeatures (Gravity)
description: Unleash supports similar feature-enabling on an individual account basis, while also being flexible enough for gradual roll-outs and split tests.

name: Large Language Models
description: Deep learning models for text generation and embeddings

name: Machine facing LLM text generation
description: Currently being used for GenomeBot and artwork captions

name: Metaphysics' v1 schema
description: The v1 schema is deprecated and should be considered frozen. Consumers should switch to v2 rather than make further modifications to v1.

name: Metaphysics' v2 schema
description: Consumers should switch to v2 rather than make further modifications to v1.

name: Next.js
description: Currently trialing Next.js for our admin apps, via the pages router. See Forque, Volt 2. Some experiments have been made to migrate to Next 13's app router, which have all run into friction. See this Slack thread for more info.

name: Objective-C
description: Because we use React Native some amount of Objective-C bridging code will remain necessary, these should be thin layers to swift features. Some legacy core Eigen infrastructure and React Native itself is written in Objective-C.

name: Opaque identifiers
description: Friendly identifiers or 'slugs' are fine for URLs but opaque, permanent identifiers are preferred for all internal or programmatic uses.

name: OpenAI
description: "OpenAI's suite of LLM services and tools for ai assisted development and application features"

name: OpenSearch
description: A community-driven
column6: open source search and analytics suite derived from Elasticsearch

name: OpsGenie
description: For incident management and alerting. Being retired by Atlassian.

name: Partner API as a product
description: "For our business partners to integrate with our platform. Documented at developers.artsy.net"

name: Phoenix
description: Phoenix is a web development framework written in Elixir which implements the server-side Model View Controller (MVC) pattern.

name: Postgresql
description: We rely on Heroku or Amazon's RDS to host these databases. Though MongoDB was chosen to host core API data, in the long run we found the data (and maybe all data) to be more relational than document-oriented.

name: Public API as a product
description: For external developers to build on our platform. Deprecated with plan to retire. Documented at developers.artsy.net

name: Python
description: For ETL, Analytics and ML workloads we use Python as a data engineering standard.

name: RabbitMQ
description: Its stream allows source systems to publish their notable events and other systems to subscribe as desired. This avoids coupling systems directly. After evaluating Kafka for this purpose, we had more operational success with RabbitMQ.

name: React Native
description: New iOS work should use React Native. See also Objective-C.

name: Rsbuild
description: a build tool powered by Rspack. It aims for high performance and to provides an out-of-the-box setup to improve DX.

name: Ruby
description: Especially for data-backed APIs and services

name: SiteFeatures (Gravity)
description: Site Features were used to turn on or off core functionality, but are easily replaced by Unleash (for platform-wide toggles) or Flipper (for Gravity-only settings).

name: Spark
description: Used for data workloads, mostly via AWS EMR Serverless.

name: Split testing
description: When scale permits (such as around high-volume product surfaces or early funnel steps), we prefer to make data-driven product decisions by evaluating user experiences in parallel through A/B- or A/B/*-style tests

name: Standard Ruby
description: After a few weeks living with this officially adopt.

name: Swift
description: We generally opt for React Native, but when necessary for quality, usability or features tightly integrated with OS, we will build native features in Swift using UIKit. see Objective-C.

name: UIKit
description: See Objective-C.

name: Unleash
description: An open-source solution for feature-flagging, gradual roll-outs, and split-testing with SDKs for multiple languages

name: User facing LLM text generation
description: Risky without human-in-the-loop, due to concerns about accuracy, safety

name: uv
description: manages project dependencies and environments

name: Vercel AI SDK
description: Solid LLM abstractions in Typescript for text and data generation, with easily swappable models

name: Weaviate
description: Vector storage database with semantic search (HNSW approximate nearest neighbor) and keyword search (BM25)

name: Webpack
description: A static module bundler for JavaScript applications
